result.execSummary:
The defendant Jontae Donald Pederson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).
  • Possess Firearm-Convicted of a Felony [Modifiers: Repeater, Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Transcript of Plea & Sentencing held on May 9th, 2022

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
9:02 AM Defendant Jontae Donald Pederson in court, in custody.  Attorney Lance Morgan Nelsen in court for Jontae Donald Pederson.  Attorney Mark Adam Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. State indicates defendant will plead to Count 2 with repeater and Count 1 with repeaters sticken. Recommend 4 years IC and 2 years ES on count 2. On count 1, 4 years fashioned as 2 years IC and 2 years ES, consecutive and consecutive to 21CF332, 0 credit, DOC programming, costs, no contact order to remain in effect, $2000 restitution.
Court recounts charges and possible penalties. Defendant pleads no contest to both counts. Court informs defendant of rights given up by their plea. Defendant understands. Attorney Nelson stipulates to a factual basis. Court accepts the Defendant's plea and finds that the Defendant's plea has been freely, voluntarily and intelligently made. The Defendant understands all the rights he is waiving by his plea. The Defendant is found guilty and Judgment of Conviction is entered. Counts 3 and 4 are dismissed but read in. 
Court orders on count 2 7 years, fashioned as 4 years IC 3 years ES, Count 1 4 years, fashioned 2 years IC, 2 years ES, consecutive and consecutive to 21CF332, 0 days credit, costs, restitution of $2,000. Payment of financial obligations, DOC programming, continuation of no contact provisions, eligible or both programs.

8:47 AM Defendant Jontae Donald Pederson in court, in custody.  Attorney Lance Morgan Nelsen in court for Jontae Donald Pederson.  Attorney Mark Adam Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. Nelson indicates settlement negotiations had, agreement reached. Needs more time.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.

9:07 AM Prosecuting attorney Chad C La Lor in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jontae Donald Pederson in court, in custody.  Attorney Lance Morgan Nelsen in court for Jontae Donald Pederson. 
State- recent offer made
Att Nelsen- Has to review with client, make counter offer
Court sets date
Status conference scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.

08:30 AM Defendant Jontae Donald Pederson in court with attorney Lance Morgan Nelsen.  Defendant Jontae Donald Pederson in custody.  Mark Adam Fruehauf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Nelsen received information, waives reading, pleads not guilty and requests status conference. State in agreement. Court sets status conference.  Status conference scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection

01:29 PM Defendant Jontae Donald Pederson in court with attorney Michael Charles Hoffman.  Defendant Jontae Donald Pederson in custody.  Peter James Marvin Kruger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jontae Donald Pederson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant's address updated and amended on complaint.  Attorney/defendant acknowledges receipt of criminal complaint, waives reading.  States request on bail: $15,000 cash bail with conditions of   No contact with victims 1-3 or their addresses listed in the ID Key,   No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription,   Do not possess any firearms. State gives prior criminal history.
Atty Hoffman indicates defendant is not employed but has been in the area for the last 16 years. Atty Hoffman questions defendant re: bail. Defendant he can post $600. 
Court states there are serious concerns about these allegations and discusses defendant just was sentenced on a prior case recently. Court Orders $15,000 cash bail with conditions of  No contact with victims 1-3 or their addresses listed in the ID Key,   No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription,  Do not possess any dangergous weapons. Text message reminder slip will be sent to the Jail.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 16, 2022 at 09:15 am.
